google_play_reviews.replyContent: Sorry to hear that. Download issues only with a (few) specific podcast(s) often are related to that (those) podcast(s), rather than the app. General issues could be related to VPN/ad-blocker etc on your phone. To find out the exact cause, please share a screenshot of the error and the podcast URL on forum.antennapod.org. We'll happily have a look!

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review, we're sorry about that experience. To save your subscriptions & play statuses: Settings » Storage » Import/Export » Database. You'll lose the downloaded media files, though. Stopping playback is often caused by the phone's system. Please first try disabling battery saving for AntennaPod in your phone settings.

Uninstalled now this software is doing ads during the podcast!!!! The Podcaster is not injecting ads in different language!!!!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi there. AntennaPod does not inject any ads. We just download the media file that the podcast host serves us. Every ad that you hear is added in the podcast either by its creator, or by the company hosting the podcast. If the ads you hear are in a different language, the host might be try to be 'smart' and inject them based on your IP address.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Issues with content aren't the fault of AntennaPod: we just download the media file that the podcaster adds in their feed. Either the podcaster added the audio, or the podcast host made an error with the file hosting. If you provide more details we'd be happy to have a look what might've happened. (You should've received an email with our message.)

google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Jocelyn, thanks for that honest review. We have taken aboard similar feedback about Android Auto. And don't hesitate to let us know if you have other suggestions!

You can always have a look at the source code of the application if you do not believe this. https://github.com/AntennaPod/AntennaPod

All in all, I'm satisfied with this app, how easy it is to use and that I can easily add and subscribe to podcasts from multiple platforms, even with built-in search engine. However, there are some bugs which make its use pretty uncomfortable: whenever I stop the playback I cannot resume it from the lock screen as the playback button showing up in the notification area seems to be dysfunctional. Even if I navigate back to the app it doesn't always work, and I sometimes need to restart the entire app in order to be able to resume the playback. There's also a bug when trying to fast forward the playback - after hitting the fast forward button 1 or 2 times it jumps forward, but after that it stops the playback. I used to think that it's just because the data isn't buffered yet, but then the playback doesn't resume at all without me opening or restarting the app, similarly as in the other case mentioned before. Please fix this bug because it's really bothering me and I was certain it will be fixed, but it's been months since I started using the app, and no fix deployed yet!
